decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Drawing no: 2025 OS 100042766 (Site Location Plan) Dated 20 February 2025  
Drawing no: TORO250 51144759772(Proposed Block Plan) Dated 20 February 2025 
Drawing no: 24/39-07 (Proposed Ground Floor Plan Amended ) Date Receivee  17 March 2025 
Drawing no: 24/39-08 (Proposed Front Elevation Plan, Proposed South Side Elevation Plan, Proposed North Side Elevation Plan, Proposed Rear Elevation Plan and Proposed Roof Plan Amended ) Date Received March 2025  
Drawing no: 24/39-01(Existing Ground Floor, Existing First Floor Plan, Existing Front Elevation Plan, Existing Rear Elevation Plan, Existing South Side Elevation Plan, Existing North Side Elevation Plan And  Existing Roof Plan)Dated  20 February 2025. 
Site Photographs 1, 2 ,3,4 and 5 Received on 20/02/2025

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - No Use of Flat Roof  - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE (Party Wall Act) - The applicant is advised to check the requirements of the Party Wall Act 1996 relating to work on an existing wall shared with another property, building on the boundary with a neighbouring property, or excavating near a neighbouring building. Further information is available at the following link: 
https://www.gov.uk/party-walls-building-works

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved without delay..

ii) The application was amended following negotiations with the Council to ensure the scheme complied with adopted policy and guidance, and a decision was made [without delay/ with an agreed determination date].

iii) The application was recommended for approval and referred to the first available Planning Committee, where the agents / applicants had an opportunity to present the application.
description: ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY SIDE AND REAR EXTENSION AND CONVERSION OF GARAGE INTO HABITABLE ROOM.
